_header: Man I-born of woman ne liveth but a stound
Subjects: scripture texts, Engl. trans. of; translations
_description: A paraphrase of Job XIV. 1-2 (4 lines), a tag in the Fasciculus morum

BodBar24.Transcription:
A man ibore of a woman lyuyth butt a stowndIn wrechydnysse and moche
                    woo hys dayys beth ifowndHe sprygyth and blossumyth þat sone fallyth
                    to growndAnd passyth as þe schadow þat no wyse ys
                    ifownd
BodBar24.Editions:
Fletcher,  Alan J. 
             “I Sing of a Maiden: A Fifteenth-Century Sermon Reminiscence.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 25 [223] (1978): 108: 108.

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Mon I borun of woman ne lyuetȝ bot a stoundeIn wrechednes &
                    in woo ben hys days I woundeHe sprykes out as blosme & sone falltȝ
                    to groundeAnd wendes a way as schadewe þat nouwes is i
                    founde

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
Man I born of woman ne leuetȝ bot astoundeIn wrechednesse &
                    in wo ben is days I woundehe sprynges out as blosme & sone falletȝ
                    to grounde& wendys awye as schadew þat neuer is I
                    founde

Bod410.Transcription:
Man iborn of woman ne lyues but a stoundeIn wrecchednes & In wo
                    ben his dayesI wounde He sprynges out as a blosme & sone falles to
                    grounde And wendes a way os shadewe þat non is I founde

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Mon iboren of wommon ne lyueth but a stoundeIn wrechednes and in wo
                    ben his dayes i woundeHe spryngus out as blossome and sone falles to
                    groundeAnd wendes away as schadewe þat no wey is ifounde
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 148-9.

CamGon364.Transcription:
Man born of woman ne leuyth but a stowdeIn wrechidnesse & in wo
                    ben hys dayes woundehe spryngyth out as blosme þat sone fallith to
                    groundeWendith a wey as a schadwe þat nowise is founde

CamStJohn159.Transcription:
Man born of a woman lefes bot astondIn wrechytnes and in woo ben all
                    hys days wondehes he sprynges out als blossom and son fallys to
                    grondeAnd wendys away as schadow þat neuer ys fonde

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Man y bore of womman ne lyuyþ but a stondeIn wreche domus an wo
                    bey al ys days þi wondehe sprynkyþ out as blossue ansone tali to
                    grondeAnt wendeþ awe as schadow þat eu neuer ys yfonde

WorcF19.Transcription:
Man y bore of womman Ne leuit bot a stoundeIn wreche deuyste and in
                    wo bet his days wenthe springit out as a blossum & sone falliþ to
                    grounde& wendys a way ase a schadew þat now is founde
WorcF19.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.451.
